newsitem.title: PERU: Peru approves transfer of Centromin rail assets.
newsitem.headline: Peru approves transfer of Centromin rail assets.

text.p: The Peruvian government said it has approved the transfer to state railway company Enafer S.A. of rail lines belonging to mining firm Centromin, which is being privatized.

A government decree said the 82-mile (132 km) branch from the mining town of Cerro de Pasco to the La Oroya smelting- refining complex and the 50-mile (80 km) Pachacayo-Yauricocha branch would be tranefered to the railway firm.

The rail lines need to be transferred in order to provide for more efficient management following the privatization of the La Oroya complex in May, said the decree, published in the official gazette El Peruano.
The rail lines, used mainly for transporting minerals extracted by Centromin, will be completed in 30 days, it said.
Centromin is undergoing piecemeal privatization. It currently operates six mines and the smelting-refining complex.
